Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Numb \Numb\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Numbed} (n[u^]md); p. pr. & vb. n. {Numbing} (n[u^]m"[i^]ng).] To make numb; to deprive of the power of sensation or motion; to render senseless or inert; to deaden; to benumb; to stupefy. [1913 Webster]
For lazy winter numbs the laboring hand. --Dryden. [1913 Webster]
Like dull narcotics, numbing pain. --Tennyson. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: desensitizing \desensitizing\ adj. making less susceptible or sensitive to either physical or emotional stimuli. Opposite of {sensitizing}. [Narrower terms: {numbing}] [WordNet 1.5]
numbing adj : causing numbness or insensitivity; "the numbing effect of grief"
